creator: todd.schwartz@intel.com
text:
This bug pertains to Xerces-J version 1.3.0.

Given the following schema:

  <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
  <xsd:schema xmlns:xsd="http://www.w3.org/2000/10/XMLSchema" 
elementFormDefault="qualified">
    <xsd:element name="ROOT">
      <xsd:complexType mixed="true">
        <xsd:sequence>
          <xsd:any namespace="##any" processContents="lax"/>
        </xsd:sequence>
      </xsd:complexType>
    </xsd:element>
  </xsd:schema>

and the following instance document:

  <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
  <ROOT xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2000/10/XMLSchema-instance" 
xsi:noNamespaceSchemaLocation="test.xsd">
    <CHILD/>
  </ROOT>

the schema validator generates two errors:
1. Element type "CHILD" must be declared.
2. The content of element type "ROOT" must match "(#PCDATA|##any)".

If the mixed attribute in the schema is changed to "false", no errors are 
generated. 

I would expect the validation to succeed in either case.
